summary: This document is an email chain from December 30-31, 2021, where FBI and NYPD officials congratulate each other on the guilty verdict in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It highlights the multi-year investigation, the team's dedication to victims, and the support from leadership. The correspondence is between Michael Osborn, Bill, and two FBI Special Agents.

persons.name: Michael Osborn
persons.role: Executive Director, Shared Investigative Services, Americas at Standard Chartered Bank
persons.context: Former FBI official who sent a congratulatory email to the investigation team after the Maxwell verdict, referencing his past involvement with the CACHT Program and ensuring the case was properly staffed.

persons.name: Bill
persons.role: Correspondent (likely law enforcement or government official)
persons.context: Sent an email echoing congratulations to the investigation team, praising their work, fidelity to victims, and professionalism, and mentioning he followed the trial daily.

persons.name: Geoff Berman
persons.role: Former U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Mentioned by Bill as someone he checked with multiple times a day during the trial, indicating high-level oversight of the case.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: One of the primary recipients of the congratulations, working in Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking at the FBI New York Field Office, who responded thanking Michael and Bill for their support.

connections.person2: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
connections.description: Osborn congratulates the agent on the Maxwell verdict and references past collaboration ensuring the case was properly staffed and prioritized.

connections.person2: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
connections.description: Bill praises the agent's work, fidelity to victims, and professionalism throughout the investigation, indicating supervisory or supportive oversight.
Bill mentions checking in with Geoff Berman and others daily during the trial, showing coordination between law enforcement and prosecution leadership.
Both are sending congratulatory messages to the investigation team, indicating they are colleagues or counterparts in supporting the case.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell guilty verdict
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was found guilty on multiple charges related to sex trafficking and abuse, marking a significant legal conclusion in the Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office

events.title: Congratulatory emails exchanged
events.description: Michael Osborn and Bill send emails congratulating the FBI/NYPD investigation team on the Maxwell verdict, reflecting on the multi-year case.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office

keyFacts: The email chain is a post-verdict celebration among law enforcement officials following Ghislaine Maxwell's conviction in December 2021.
Officials highlight the multi-year investigation, challenges faced, and the team's dedication to giving voice to vulnerable victims.
The correspondence reveals high-level support and oversight from figures like Geoff Berman and unnamed ADICs (Assistant Directors in Charge).
Michael Osborn references the CACHT Program (Child Abuse and Child Human Trafficking) and his role in ensuring the case was properly staffed.
The emails emphasize the personal toll and sacrifices made by the investigation team over the three-year period.
